title: Complaining about the job market
context: Complain that every company wants five years of experience for entry-level jobs.

content.bestLine: Every company wants five years of experience for entry-level jobs, it's crazy

neutral.text: Most companies require too much experience
I'm tired of seeing five years of experience required
The job market is tough for new graduates
It's hard to get a job without experience
Companies should consider training new employees
The job market is not friendly to newcomers
I wish companies would give people a chance

informal.text: It's wild that they want five years of experience for an entry-level job
I'm so done with these crazy experience requirements
The job market is hella tough right now
I'm trying to get a job, but it's hard without experience
I just want a chance to prove myself
It's frustrating to see these experience requirements everywhere
I'm starting to think I'll never get a job

slang.text: It's lowkey ridiculous that they want five years of experience
I'm highkey frustrated with the job market
Companies are being extra with these experience requirements
I'm trying to get a job, but it's a whole thing
The job market is a mess, fam
I'm just trying to get my foot in the door

patterns.template: Every company wants [options] years of experience
I'm so [options] with the job market
patterns.meaning: expressing frustration with the job market

dialogs.description: Talking to a friend about job search

lines.speaker: Person A
lines.text: I'm so frustrated with the job market

lines.speaker: Person B
lines.text: I feel you, every company wants five years of experience for entry-level jobs

dialogs.description: Discussing job search with a career counselor

lines.speaker: Person A
lines.text: I'm having trouble finding a job without experience

lines.speaker: Person B
lines.text: It's tough, but we can work on building your skills and experience to make you a more competitive candidate
